channel.title: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!
channel.description:
First off, i'll apologise in advanced if this question has already been answered. Although i don't think it has.
Basically, i've created everything to do with my server. (I am using Hamachi due to portforwarding issues, ect ect). When using a compiler it said i did not have Jdk 5.0 or 6.0. But My computer is refusing to accept java. I have been using a guide that was utilising an out dated java (Posted by Apoc, made by 1o9), but i am using java SDK 6u18. So when it came to editing the environmental values i hit a snag. I did the logical thing and replaced the: C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin with, C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0.18\bin;. But, it still hasnt worked. So, if anyone could just tell me a simple way of editing the enviromental values then i would be extremely gratefull.

item.title: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!
item.dc:creator: @axonn112 axonn112
item.description:
@axonn112 wrote:

Thanks to everyone. Problem solved. If a mod could please lock or delete this i’d be very gratefull…

Read full topic

@lildude783 wrote:

… well go into ur program files folder in ur C drive… find the java and the jdk1.6.0_18 … and then copy and paste the Address that you should have…

if you have windows 7 or a newer version of windows or linux or mac it’ll not be in program files… it’ll be in a weirdly named programs folder…

item.title: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!
item.dc:creator: @axonn112 axonn112
item.description:
@axonn112 wrote:

Sorry wait, let me refrase that. What exactly do i need in my environmental values boxes. I have java 6u18. Heres a Prntscrn just to help:

To Fox0wnage: Thanks for the quick reply but i still do not think that it worked. Thanks for your help anyway.

Read full topic
item.source: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!

item.title: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!
item.dc:creator: @Fox0wnage Fox0wnage
item.description:
@Fox0wnage wrote:

It’s probably not a problem with your variables.
Go to your compiler.bat > right click > edit
Try replacing everything inside with this:

@echo off @TITLE Your Server Here if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. :end echo Finished! pause exit

The problem can easily be that your compiler isn’t set to find your version of JDK or JRE.
If you like your compiler and don’t want to replace, edit the .bat and replace all the JDK parts in it with your version of JDK.
E.g. “C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_11\bin\javac.exe” *.java If you have JDK 1.6.0_14, then replace the 11 with 14.

Hope I helped

Read full topic
item.source: Urgent help Required! Enviromental Value Problems!
